page.title: 12...ENTERTAINMENT
page.content: Entertainment in the form of live theatre, opera or cinema is not a feature of the area because of the lack of facilities. The ever increasing use of home videos has superceded the need for films on the large screen. Many people enjoy bingo sessions which are readily available at some of the community centres and clubs. There are many public houses offering entertain- ment in the form of live groups to cater for a variety of tastes. Discos are also popular and even the youngest can enjoy some that are held. Senior citizens are able to attend special dance sessions and there are drop-in clubs at some of the centres. The comparative inadequacy of some facilities in the area should be alleviated somewhat when the Firs and Bromford Sports and Community Centre is opened on the 29th June 1985.
